Description: Six joining rim and floor fragments of North Ionian pottery plate; on underside, bands; on top of rim meander hooks; on bowl band of alternating tongues and lotus flowers; central, lotus and bud star. The friezes are separated by black bands with added red bands lined in white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Also published in: Kerschner 2001, Pl. 10, 4; Walter-Karydi 1973, Pl. 123, 1002, Fairbanks, 1928, p. 112, pl. XXXV, no. 323.5; M. Kerschner, Perspektiven der Keramikforschung in Naukratis (1999) 85, 87 Pl. 10,4.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 220-1, no. 78)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 82, Nau 19, pl. 4f)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 112, pl. XXXV, no. 323.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.801)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 1002, pl. 123)
